[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Recovery confusion] Can an attacker emit fake KeyRotation events that cause wallet recovery tools to derive incorrect account addresses, leading to fund loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Historical replay] Can historical KeyRotation events be replayed or reordered during wallet recovery to confuse the key derivation chain? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Partial recovery] If some KeyRotation events are missing or corrupted, can wallet recovery still work correctly, or will it derive wrong addresses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Multi-device sync] Can KeyRotation events create race conditions when the same wallet is being recovered on multiple devices simultaneously? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Feature flag exploitation] Can the module_event_migration_enabled() feature flag be manipulated to cause inconsistent event emission between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Migration rollback] If the migration from KeyRotationEvent to KeyRotation is rolled back, are there any events that get lost or become unprocessable? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Version confusion] Can clients or indexers get confused between KeyRotationEvent (legacy) and KeyRotation (v2), processing the same rotation twice? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Backward compatibility] Are there any breaking changes in KeyRotation compared to KeyRotationEvent that could cause issues with existing tooling? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Function: try_from_bytes()] [CPU exhaustion] Can maliciously crafted BCS bytes cause excessive CPU usage during deserialization, creating a DoS vector against validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Event store bloat] Can an attacker rotate their key repeatedly with large authentication keys to bloat the event store indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Validator sync delay] Can excessive KeyRotation events slow down new validators trying to sync historical state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Trait: MoveStructType] [VM bytecode injection] Can an attacker craft Move bytecode that creates KeyRotation events with invalid internal state that the VM doesn't detect? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Trait: MoveStructType] [Gas metering bypass] Can KeyRotation event emission bypass gas metering if the event size is calculated incorrectly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Trait: MoveStructType] [Module loading exploit] Can malicious modules that depend on the account module manipulate how KeyRotation is instantiated or emitted? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Trait: MoveEventV2Type] [Event emission limits] Are there limits on how many KeyRotation events can be emitted per transaction, or can this be abused? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Timestamp/ordering] Does KeyRotation include timestamp information, and if not, can events be reordered in ways that break causal ordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Chain ID absence] Does KeyRotation include chain_id to prevent cross-chain replay attacks, or is this vulnerability present? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Transaction hash] Is there a reference to the transaction that emitted this event, or can events be ambiguous about their origin? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Proof of knowledge] Does the event verify that the rotation was authorized by proof-of-knowledge of both old and new keys, or just record the change? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/events/key_rotation.rs] [Struct: KeyRotation] [Delegation tracking] Can KeyRotation events distinguish between self-rotation and rotation via RotationCapability delegation? (Medium)
